setting.location: Empty personal quarters aboard research station orbiting planet Solaris
setting.weather: Artificial atmosphere feeling hollow and lifeless

characters.appearance: Man, early 30s, brown hair wild from sleep, face showing progression from hope to crushing realization
characters.clothing: Sleeping clothes, hastily thrown on in desperate search
characters.position: Standing in center of empty room, slowly turning to comprehend complete absence
characters.action: Searching frantically at first, then gradually stopping as reality sinks in, shoulders sagging with devastating loss

scene.mainElements: Personal quarters now feeling vast and empty despite small size, all traces of shared presence erased, morning light highlighting emptiness
scene.details: Bed made perfectly with no indentation from second person, single cup on table instead of two, personal belongings arranged as if for one person only, folded note on pillow, no text or letters visible
scene.background: Station walls seeming to expand with emptiness, porthole showing alien planet continuing indifferently, mechanical sounds more noticeable in the absence of human presence
scene.atmosphere: Crushing emotional devastation, complete loneliness after perfect connection, realization that voluntary sacrifice has occurred, emptiness more profound than before companionship existed

composition.cameraAngle: Wide shot emphasizing emptiness and isolation
composition.focus: Solitary figure surrounded by evidence of abandonment
composition.depth: Isolated character in center foreground, empty domestic space in middle ground, indifferent station environment in background

colorPalette.usageNotes: Cool tones dominate with pops of vibrant neon lighting

lineArt.texture: smooth digital, hard edges on tech

lighting.intensity: high contrast (bright neon vs deep shadow)
lighting.highlights: lens flares, neon glows on surfaces

rendering.texture: smooth with textured brushes for atmosphere
rendering.detailLevel: high in focal points (tech details), looser elsewhere

perspective: dynamic perspective (wide-angle vistas or low-angle hero shots)
